t: Haggai 2
The Coming Glory of God’s House
In*p the seventh month,*i on the twenty-first of the month, the word of the Lord*s came by Haggai the prophet, saying:
“Speak now to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and to the remnant of the people, saying:
‘Who is left among you who saw this temple in its former glory? And how do you see it now? In comparison with it, is*i this*i not in your eyes as nothing?

Yet now be strong, Zerubbabel,’ says the Lord;*s ‘and be strong, Joshua, son of Jehozadak, the high priest; and be strong, all you people of the land,’ says the Lord,*s ‘and work; for I am*i with you,’ says the Lord*s of hosts.
‘According*i to*i the word that I covenanted with you when you came out of Egypt, so My Spirit remains among you; do not fear!’
“For*p thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Once more (it is*i a little while) I will shake heaven and earth, the sea and dry land;
and I will shake all nations, and they shall come to the Desire of All Nations, and I will fill this temple with glory,’ says the Lord*s of hosts.
‘The silver is*i Mine, and the gold is*i Mine,’ says the Lord*s of hosts.
‘The glory of this latter temple shall be greater than the former,’ says the Lord*s of hosts. ‘And in this place I will give peace,’ says the Lord*s of hosts.”
The People Are Defiled
On*p the twenty-fourth day*i of the ninth month,*i in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord*s came by Haggai the prophet, saying,
“Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Now, ask the priests concerning*i the*i law, saying,
“If one carries holy meat in the fold of his garment, and with the edge he touches bread or stew, wine or oil, or any food, will it become holy?”’” Then*p the priests answered and said, “No.”
And*p Haggai said, “If one*i who*i is*i unclean because*i of a dead body touches any of these, will it be unclean?” So*p the priests answered and said, “It shall be unclean.”
Then*p Haggai answered and said, “‘So is this people, and so is this nation before Me,’ says the Lord,*s ‘and so is every work of their hands; and what they offer there is unclean.
Promised Blessing
‘And*p now, carefully consider from this day forward: from before stone was laid upon stone in the temple of the Lord—*s
since those days,*i when one*i came to a heap of twenty ephahs, there were but*i ten; when one*i came to the wine vat to draw out fifty baths from the press, there were but*i twenty.
I struck you with blight and mildew and hail in all the labors of your hands; yet you did not turn*i to Me,’ says the Lord.*s
‘Consider now from this day forward, from the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, from the day that the foundation of the Lord’s*s temple was laid—consider it:
Is the seed still in the barn? As yet the vine, the fig tree, the pomegranate, and the olive tree have not yielded fruit.*i But*i from this day I will bless you.’”*i
Zerubbabel Chosen as a Signet
And*p again the word of the Lord*s came to Haggai on the twenty-fourth day of the month, saying,
“Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying: ‘I*pn will shake heaven and earth.

I*ld will overthrow the throne of kingdoms; I*ld will destroy the strength of the Gentile kingdoms. I*ld will overthrow the chariots And*ld those who ride in them; The*ld horses and their riders shall come down, Every*ld one by the sword of his brother.

‘In*p that day,’ says the Lord*s of hosts, ‘I will take you, Zerubbabel My servant, the son of Shealtiel,’ says the Lord,*s ‘and will make you like a signet ring;*i for I have chosen you,’ says the Lord*s of hosts.”
